Have you ever gone on a trip where you didn't know the destination? Just said.. YES?
That was my last project in Santa Fe on assignment for @CapitalOne . Diving back into the culture, the food and the incredible nature New Mexico has to offer reminded me a lot of my childhood exploring this area. 
I was working on the launch of the new Venture X card that allows people to do what they love wherever and whenever that may be. For me it looked a bit like the REEL above. On location we enjoyed the milky way above Diablo Canyon, endless singletrack and an epic stay at Bishops Lodge to celebrate Venture X’s 10X earn on hotels booked through Capital One Travel.

The Long Way Around

What we have here isn’t your typical bike trip. Four close friends ventured into the great woods of the American west to experience the land via bike. Their original plans thwarted due to the devastation of wildfires that seemly strike the west more and more each year. With some last-minute rearranging of the route and a nod that it was safe, the ride was on! They took off to experience a ride and hike that some might call, downright insanity.

It is not enough to be busy. We must always be engaged, at capacity. We fill in the empty spaces of our daily lives with the superficial. We live in a way that erroneously equates speed and efficiency to value and worth. 

But what happens when we slow down? We value the price of our lives as the time we spend instead of the time we save.  
 
Take the time to invest in the slowness around you. Explore the texture of the world and the playfulness of the ordinary.

This summer solstice I focused on one goal: riding from dawn until dusk, from San Francisco to Yosemite with my compadre @dylanbuffington & @pasnormalstudios
